description.narrative: The PDO is to improve the management of water resources through the strengthening of the Borrower's capacity for participatory, integrated, basin-scale water water resources management (WRM) at the central level and in selected river basins.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Agreement - Section I.E.2. | Description :Not later than 45 days after effectiveness date, the PIU shallimplement the financial management system and hire the financial andp rocurement specialists | Due Date :01-Jun-2011

Finance Agreement :Project agreement - Section I. E. 3. | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall provide adequateoffice facilities in Lima for the operation of the Project | Due Date :01-May-2010

Finance Agreement :Project agreement - schedule 1 - Section I.E.1. | Description :Not later than June 30, 2010, the ProjectImplementing Entity shall establish and thereafter maintain throughout the Project impleme ntation, the River Basin Councils forthe Pilot River Basins | Due Date :31-May-2011

Finance Agreement :Project agreement - schedule 1 section I.B.1. | Description :Not later than December 31, 2009, the ProjectImplementing Entity shall enter into an agreement with MINEDU under terms and conditio ns satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date:31-May-2010

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A. 1. | Description :The borrower shall, not later than 30 days after effectiveness date,create and thereafter maintain, until completion of the project , a project steering committee | Due Date :18-Mar-2011

Finance Agreement :schedule 2 section I. A. 3. | Description :Not later than 60 days after the signing if this Agreement, theBorrower shall create a project implementation unit (PIU), with admi nistrative, financial and budgetary autonomy | Due Date:23-Jan-2010

title.narrative: Implementation agreement between ANA and SENAHMI executed.
Number of agricultural and non-agricultural water rights formalized in Chancay-Lambayeque, Ica-Alto - Pampas (Huancavelica) and Chili
Number of water quality monitoring points measured annually in the Chili basin
Number of communication campaigns for the diffusion of the new "Cultura del Agua"
Number of agricultural and non-agricultural water rights consolidated in Chancay-Lambayeque, Ica-Alto - Pampas (Huancavelica) and Chili
Number of teachers trained in "Cultura del Agua"
Number of regional governments in which "cultura del agua" has been introduced in the curricula of primary schools
Improve hydro-meteorological and water quality monitoring networks in pilot river basins

target.value: Hydro-meteorological networks improved in the three pilot river basins and water quality monitoring established in one basin.

actual.value: Target reached.

title.narrative: River Basin Organizations created and participative IWRM plans formulated and adopted in three pilot river basins

target.value: Participative, integrated WRM plans adopted by CCs in three pilot river basins. Each pilot river basin is under the responsibilityof one CC and one AAA.

actual.value: Target Reached

title.narrative: Multisectoral river basin committees created in four river basins.

baseline.value: No multisectoral river basin committees have been created under the Project.

target.value: Multisectoral river basin committees have been created in four river basins.

actual.value: In two river basins the target has been surpassed, with the creation of two River Basin Councils (with more authority thanmultisectoral committees). In the other two, the awareness campaigns are still ongoing.

title.narrative: National Water information system created and running

baseline.value: Peru does not have a consolidated National Information System.

target.value: The NWIS is created and operational and integrates, at least, ANA and SENAMHI data.

actual.value: The NWIS is created and running and integrates ANA. Hydromet stations have been transferred to SENAMHI but calibration is stillpending.

title.narrative: Water quality management strategy and responsibilities defined

actual.value: The strategy is ready and in the last approval stage with MINAGRI. Dissemination is planned for November 2015.

title.narrative: Agreement between ANA and Ministry of Education for the promotion of "Cultura del Agua" passed and satisfactorily implemented.

target.value: 100% Agreement between ANA and the Ministry of Education for the promotion of "Cultura del Agua" signed.

actual.value: 100% Agreement signed in 2012

target.value: 100% Models designed by the consulting firm

actual.value: 100% Models designed

title.narrative: Number of discharges identified, classified and monitored in the Chili and Chancay-Lambayeque basins.

actual.value: 331 discharges identified and classified

title.narrative: Number proposals for small emergency interventions for maintenance, repair or replacement of small hydraulic works and equipment approved and fulfilling the Project safeguards requirements if applicab

actual.value: Did not apply, no emergency situation occurred.

title.narrative: Indigenous Peoples Planning Framework applied to the development of the IWRM plan where relevant.

actual.value: IPPF was developed and applied. Target reached.

title.narrative: Increased knowledge and skills of decision-makers to apply IWRM at the national and river basin level.

actual.value: 105 professionals received qualifications from the formation program.

title.narrative: Stakeholders, through their representative organizations, participate in the updating and validate preliminary IWRM plans.

target.value: 100% - Stakeholders are participating in the update and validate the plans.

actual.value: 100% Target reached.

title.narrative: Number of meteorological and hydrological stations installed, upgraded, automated and/or relocated

actual.value: 100% corresponding to 28 stations

title.narrative: Operational units with adequate human resources (ANA, and concerned SENAHMI units)

actual.value: 100% of staff operational

title.narrative: Improved knowledge and practices of the general public in IWRM at the river basin level.
Number of water professionals and decision makers trained on IWRM
Multisectoral River Basin Water committees established

actual.value: Interventions in two river basins:(i) Jequetepeque-Zaña: awaiting regional governments approval to create the committee (LaLibertad, Lambayeque y Cajamara); (ii) Tambo-Santiago-Ica: in the representatives selection stage, with the approval planned forDecember 2015.

title.narrative: Methodology for designing IWRM plan established
River Basin Councils (CC) established and operational
Number of annual hit counts for the Web site
National Water Information Center operative, disseminating information for IWRM.

target.value: Information Center operative and disseminating information.

actual.value: Information Center operative and disseminating information.

title.narrative: General methodology for cost calculation of WRM at the river basin level designed and implemented.

target.value: Final version of the methodology completed.

actual.value: Final version of the methodology completed.

title.narrative: Three nodes established in the pilot basins.

actual.value: 85% established; the decision-making rooms are in place but some equipment still needs to be installed.

title.narrative: Web site disseminating water resources information opertational.

actual.value: Web site is operational with basic information and additional information applications developed

target.value: 100% working group fully staffed and operational.

actual.value: Working group established with relevant organizationd (Ministries of Mining, Environment, Health, Housing and Production.

title.narrative: Number of meteorological and hydrometric stations operational
Staff adequately trained for operating the National Water Information System.

target.value: 100% staff and equipment complete and operational.

actual.value: Operational with trained staff.
